page.title: 12Focus on two restaurants.1
page.content: Considering the size of the population (12,000+) the area seems surprisingly well served by pubs selling food(14), night clubs(2) and restaurants/residential hotels(3). The restaurants in particular were seen as bringing valuable trade into the area, and to test this we qestioned the assistant managers of two of them, The Beeches and Cassinelli's. They both agreed that proximity of the motorway had contributed to their choice of site. Both had large car parks, and the Beeches reckoned to serve about 800 non-residents in an average week, while Cassinelli's expected between 15 and 16 hundred people. On a Saturday evening, the most popular time,110 would be served at the Beeches, and 150-165 at Cassinelli's, but Monday is a quiet day.
